title: The Daily Anna - Chapter 9
body:
Master Post

This is a really important chapter, and I’m not going to lie, I got a little emotional while I was writing it, so I’m going to apologise now. Let me know how you’re feeling about it all. 

Again, a massive shout out to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for helping me with this chapter and all the others, this story really wouldn’t have happened without her. 

                                                         ***

Anna was sick of the heat. London had suffered through weeks of abnormally hot weather and now she was counting down the days until Autumn began. Her flat was on the 5th floor of her building and she just couldn’t cool it down no matter how hard she tried, and Harry’s house wasn’t much better, but there were at least a few rooms that didn’t get direct sunlight that they could hide away in. The only problem was, Harry lived on the other side of London and that meant that a long stuffy tube ride to get there and she knew that would probably give her another headache, but if she wanted to be cool, she didn’t really have another choice. So she gathered her things together and made sure she got her cold bottle of water out of the fridge and locked the door behind her.

The heat hit her as soon as she left the building, and she let out an audible huff which made passers by turn their heads and nod at her, acknowledging their own disgust for the hot air. It was a slow walk to the underground but by the time she got there she was already covered in a film of sweat and she couldn’t wait to get to Harry’s. She sat down sat down in the corner of the compartment and pulled her phone out, putting her headphones in and pressing play on her audiobook, hoping that she could focus on something else. With her eyes closed she drifted into a world of her own but it didn’t take long for the headache and stomach pains to set in. She took a sip from her water bottle and drew in a deep breath, her hand clenching her stomach waiting for it to subside a little. When it did, she picked her phone up again and sent Harry a message.

“Can you pick me up from the station, it’s too hot to walk”

“Of course, how far off are you?”

“Two stops”

“I’ll leave now then, see you soon xx”

Anna kept taking in deep breathes as she watched out the window at the black tunnell passing by. She knew she’d be ok once she was out in the open again but right now she wasn’t sure she was going to make it without hurling her guts all through the train compartment. But she did make it and she was the first to get off at her stop. The heat in the underground was almost unbearable though and Anna couldn’t wait to get outside where there was the slightest breeze to cool her a little. True to his word, Harry was waiting outside the tube station in his car and Anna jogged over to it.

“Hi Styles” she huffed, taking her seat leaning over to kiss his cheek

“Bit hot out there?” he laughed

“It’s disgusting, almost puked all over the tube”

His expression fell at the mention of Anna being unwell “You alright now?”

“Yeah” she nodded “I just needed some air”

Harry’s house was cool, he had all the blinds and curtains shut off so that the sun couldn’t get in and his back guest room was set up so that they could spend the entire day in there, escaping the harsh heat. He’d moved the bed out and laid a picnic blanket on the floor with two pillows for them to rest on. His favourite guitar, the one that he used to play “Oh Anna” on tour was sitting in the corner and he had a stack of DVDs sitting on the coffee table, ready for them to watch.

Anna made herself comfortable on the picnic rug and pulled out her laptop. Today was a work day, they’d agreed on that before she came over but the weather made it hard to focus and eventually, Anna gave up on the proposal she was working on and sat and watched as Harry strummed on his guitar. He wasn’t doing anything in particular, just recording a few new riffs that he might be able to use for new songs when he finally gets back into the studio. He had his brown leather notebook laid out and was scrawling lone lyrics down as they came to him but Anna had other ideas for the page and she began doodling all over it, mostly tiny little cartoons of the two of them together and a few other little characters.

“I didn’t know you could draw” Harry said after watching her for a while

“I can’t really, I have a doctors appointment tomorrow” Anna said softly when Harry stopped strumming his guitar, “Trying to keep myself distracted”

He put the guitar down and looked at her “Do you want me to come?”

Anna stayed quiet for a moment mulling over her answer “I think so” she finally uttered

“I don’t have to” he said “But I know you’re nervous”

“No, I want you to” she smiled “It’s at 11:30”

“Stay here tonight, I’ll cook us breakfast in the morning” he leant over and kissed her forehead “Everything’s going to be fine An”

“Thanks H” she closed her laptop and laid down on the picnic blanket, staring up at the roof. The air outside had cooled slightly and in the distance dark clouds were rolling in bringing with them the cool change that they so desperately waited for.

Thunder storms had always been Anna’s favourite part of Summer, she loved how the world went dark just beforehand, like the city had suddenly been taken over by dementors, and the rain. She loved watching the rain fall down, and on a day like today, she loved to sit out in it and cool down.

“Let’s go outside” she said after a few minutes of silence after their last conversation.

Harry stood and opened the blinds revealing the dark sky “It’s about to rain love”

“Exactly” she stood and held her hand out, enticing him to grab on. He did, shrugging and grabbing his phone off the floor as Anna dragged him out of the room. She went straight for the back door, but Harry pulled her back towards the stairs.

“No no no” he smiled “if we’re going to be out in the rain, we’re doing it right”

“The rain is that way” Anna giggled pointing at the back door.

“Nope” he kept walking up the stairs “I have a rooftop garden”  

“Of course you do” she rolled her eyes.

They climbed the stairs to the second floor where Harry’s bedroom was and then he dragged her up past his office and the guest bedrooms on the third floor and up to the fourth where Anna had never been before. There wasn’t much to it, a sitting room with a grand piano and some artwork, which Anna guessed was worth more than everything she owned and then some. Thunder roared just as Harry unlocked the door to the rooftop and he flinched a little.

“Not scared of thunder are you Styles?” Anna giggled, walking backwards out into the storm

“No” he huffed, offended that she thought he was scared of anything.

“Whatever” she turned around and took in the view, clouds still rolling in over the city, which was almost entirely visible from there.

“This might just be the best view in London” she said, turning around and looking at it from all angles.

“Yeah” he said, his gaze focused not on the skyline that surrounded them, but on Anna who was completely oblivious to the fact.

A few lone drops started to fall from the sky and Anna stretched her arms out to catch them and then the lone drops turned into a flood of water falling from the sky and she couldn’t stop herself from laughing. Harry was still standing under the eves of the house, watching Anna enjoy the storm, a huge smile stretched across his face.

“Get your butt out here Styles” she said through her giggles, holding her hand out and grabbing onto his. Reluctantly he followed and rain fell down his back, cooling his whole body and turning his white shirt transparent, revealing his chest full of tattoos. With Anna’s hand already in his he pulled her in closer to him, so that they were standing only inches away from each other.

“Let’s sit” Anna whispered, pulling him down to the ground with her. Their bodies were entirely soaked by now, their hair sticking to their faces and dripping down their backs. Lightning flashed across the sky, turning the clouds from black to purple and Anna rested her head on Harry’s shoulders.

“Isn’t this beautiful H?” she whispered, looking up at him.

“You’re beautiful An” he kissed her forehead and used his pointer finger to lift her chin so that she was looking directly at him.

“I love you Anna Louise Elliot”

There they were. Those three words she’d wanted to say for weeks now, finally rolling off his tongue, sending shivers down her spine.

“I love you too Harry Edward Styles” she giggled “always will”

***

“Miss Elliot” Anna’s doctor poked her head around the corner and ushered both her and Harry into the room.

“Just here for a check up today love?” she smiled.

“Not exactly,” Anna blushed “I’ve been having these stomach pains for a while now, they were going away but now it’s constant”

“Ok” Doctor O’connell said, in a soft, sweet tone that only emphasized her Irish accent “Do you remember when it started?”

“Back in June, it started as a migraine”

“And how’s your appetite been?”

“Not great this week, even the thought of food makes me ill”

She nodded, taking some notes on her computer “When was your last period love?”

Anna’s eyes widened “Two months ago”

“Is there a chance you could be pregnant?”

Anna and Harry looked at each other, both of them blushing. Harry’s hand moved onto Anna’s knee, a gesture of comfort.  

“I guess I could be?”  Anna said, embarrassed that she hadn’t thought of that before now.

“When was the last time you had sex?”

“Last Night” they both said quietly but in unison.

“And before that?”

“Friday” Harry said before clearing his throat

“Are you using Condoms?” Dr O’Connell asked, looking at them over her glasses

They both nodded but didn’t say anything, too shocked by the thought of a baby.

“Right well there’s always a chance, so let’s rule that out before we go looking for something else” She turned in her chair and opened the drawer sitting next to her desk, pulling out a specimen jar and slammed it down on the desk next to Anna.

“There’s a bathroom just down the hall, bring this back when you’re finished”

She took the jar and stood from her chair, passed her handbag to Harry without and word and walked out of the room. This couldn’t be real. A baby? How could she be a mother, she could barely look after herself and how could Harry be a dad? He was too busy with work to be able to give the child enough of his time, christ even yesterday when Anna was over he couldn’t leave his guitar alone long enough for them to have a full conversation. Not that she minded, she loved it when he sang. They’d been so careful she wasn’t on the pill, but they always, always used condoms. There was no way there could be a baby in there.

She slid back into Dr O'connell’s office after using the bathroom, with the jar in her hand and placed it back on the desk, red faced with embarrassment.

“Right then” the doctor said warmly as she put on a pair of gloves “Let’s find out if there’s a baby in there.”

Harry held on tightly to Anna knee while they waited for the results to show up on the test stick. Anna’s heart was practically beating out of her chest and Harry couldn’t stop pulling his lip with his free hand. It took three minutes for the results to show, but it felt like three hours and by the time Dr O'connell opened her mouth Anna felt like she was about to throw up.

“It’s negative” she said

They both let out a deep sigh. Thank God. Now wasn’t the time for babies. Harry loosened his grip on Anna’s knee but kept his hand there, because if there was no baby, there was something else.

“Ok, let’s talk more about these stomach pains then because missing two periods isn’t a good sign, what kind of pain is it?” she was speaking with a tone of concern now, instead of excitement.

“Usually, it’s a dull ache all over, but when it gets worse it’s sharp and on my sides”

“Hmmm” she tapped her pen on the desk “could be kidney’s, why don’t you pop up on that bed over there and I’ll examine you”

Anna stood up again and walked over to the examination table. Kidney’s. Couldn’t they go back to the baby idea? That was way less scary. She laid down on the sterilised paper sheets and lifted her shirt just below her bra. Dr O'connell drew the curtains so that Harry couldn’t see and began pressing on Anna’s belly.

“You tell me where it hurts love” she said softly

“Everywhere” she choked until she pressed on her left side, “There” she squeaked “That hurts”

Dr O’Connell took her hands away and helped Anna sit up.

“Ok, next step is to take some bloods and we’ll see what’s going on inside. Are you ok with needles?”

“No” Anna shook her head

“That’s what he’s for” she drew the curtains back and smiled at Harry. “Your presence is required good sir”

Harry giggled “What are boyfriends for”

“Hold her hand and tell her she’s pretty while I get things ready”

There was a reason Anna like Dr O'Connell so much, and it wasn’t necessarily because of her medical expertise, it was more her bedside manner. She always made Anna laugh and that made everything less scary.

“You are very pretty” Harry said “Even if you do look a little pale right now”

Anna smiled sheepishly and grabbed onto Harry’s outstretched hand “I hate needles”

“It’s just a tiny pinch, and you can squeeze my hand as hard as you need to”

The Doctor walked back over to them with a tray of all the things that she needed to take Anna’s blood.

“I’ve gotten good at this over the years love, you won’t even feel it” she said reassuringly, pulling a pair of gloves over her hands and using an alcohol wipe to sterilise the area. Anna held tightly onto to Harry’s hand and squeezed her eyes shut so that she didn’t have to watch what was happening. A tiny sting in her left arm let her know that needle was in and before she knew it Dr O'connell was finished.

“All done dear” she smiled. “Come back and sit down over near the desk and we’ll go over what happens next”

They both followed her back and sat down. Anna didn’t know how she felt at this point, she thought she was nervous, but she didn’t know if that was just the pains coming back again.

“Unfortunately, Anna there’s not much more I can do for you until we get your blood work back, but I want to send you for an ultrasound on your kidneys as well see if we can get a better idea of what’s causing you all this pain.” She turned to her computer and printed out an order for the ultrasound and handed it to Anna. “You make sure you’re drinking plenty of fluids in this weather, you need to stay hydrated” She stood from her chair, which promoted Anna and Harry to do the same

“Thank you for all of your help Dr O’Connell” Anna said

“It’s my pleasure dear, it will take a day or two, but I’ll give you a call with your results, and you make that appointment for that scan as soon as you can” She ushered them out the door

“I will” Anna smiled “Thank you”

***

“Those one’s” Harry said pointing to the red pair of sunglasses that sat on Anna’s dressing table

“Really?” Anna questioned “You think she’ll like them?

“She’ll like you so it doesn’t matter”  he checked his phone to see that it was already twenty past eleven “she won’t if we’re late though, we better get going”

“Fine” Anna huffed pushing the sunglasses onto her face

“You look stunning as always, plus she’s my sister so she doesn’t care what you look like”

Anna was finally getting to meet Gemma, and to say that she was nervous was an understatement. She knew how much his family meant to Harry and she also knew much he cared what they thought.

“Have you got your phone love?” He asked before closing the door to her flat

“When do I not have my phone?” she giggled

“Just checking, Dr O'connell might ring back, that’s all”

That was the last thing she needed to be reminded of right now, but it had been a few days since her appointment and the blood results would be back any time now.

They weren’t doing anything overly exciting with Gemma, just a pub lunch, Charli had even agreed to join them and take the pressure off a little. It didn’t help that Anna wasn’t feeling well anyway, but when they walked in and saw that Gemma was already sitting at the bar, Anna’s stomach dropped.

“It’s a little early for wine isn’t Gems?” Harry said, startling her.

“I thought it was getting close to five, you’re so late” she said sarcastically although Anna was pretty sure she wasn’t joking

“Sorry” Harry sighed “My fault, couldn’t find my car keys”

She shrugged and Anna let go of the breath that she’d taken when Gemma mentioned being late, grateful that Harry had taken the blame.

“I haven’t seen you in months, where’s my hug?” she said.

Harry obliged and wrapped his arms around her. It warmed Anna’s heart how close they were, even after spending months apart they could go back to being the best of friends, which said something about them both as people.

As they pulled away from the hug, Gemma turned straight to Anna and held out her hand.

“I’m Gemma, it’s nice to finally meet you, this dickhead hasn’t shut up about you since he met you”

“Likewise” Anna smiled “I’m Anna by the way”

“I know hun” Gemma nodded. “Alright, let’s find somewhere to sit, shall we?”

“Let’s go outside, it’s too nice out to be inside” Anna added, needing the fresh air to calm her nerves.

“Good idea” Harry nodded and grabbed onto her hand.

Once they found a seat and ordered their meals, Anna began to ease into the conversation and by the time Charli arrived, Anna couldn’t remember why she was so nervous about this, Gemma was just as lovely as Harry. She wasn’t over protective of him, she didn’t question why Anna was with him and maybe that was because she could see that he was totally in love with her and that’s all that matters.

“Hiya” Charli said as she made her way over to their table “I’m so so sorry I’m late, got stuck in a meeting”

“Happens to the best of us” Harry said, smiling at her

“I ordered you some vegetarian lasagna” Anna said, moving closer to Harry so that Charli could sit down next to her

“I’m Charli,” she said to Gemma “Anna’s manger slash best friend”

“I’m Gemma” she said in response “Harry’s sister slash life coach”

“That’s a bold statement” Harry chimed in “Don’t let jeffy hear you say that”

“Aww, I miss Jeffy” Gemma sighed “How is he?”

Conversion continued to flow easily as Harry and Anna recapped the tour, and Gemma and Charli filled them both in on what they’d missed in London while they’d been gone. There were times when they would break into two separate conversations but it always came back to the four of them and Harry always kept his hand on Anna’s knee.

Their food arrived and everyone started eating but the smell of it made Anna feel ill and she was only a few bites in before she had to stop. Harry knew not to say anything in front of Gemma, but he gave her a worried look that she just shrugged off, not being able to do anything about it right now.

“That looks good, An” Harry said, a mouth still half full of his own lunch “Can I steal some?”

She could see what he was doing and she played along “Don’t you ever eat your own food?” she said sarcastically to make the whole thing look more real.

“Yours looks better” he shrugged reaching over and taking some chips from her plate

“He’s always been like this” Gemma added, “won’t settle until he’s tried everyone’s food”

“Don’t want any of yours” he said, using his fork to take a mouthful of pasta from Anna’s plate. He continued to subtly take her food, until her plate was almost empty and her phone started to ring. His grip tightened on her knee when he saw that the number on her screen was Dr O'Connell’s. She looked at him nervously before she picked it up and stood from her seat at the table, walking away so that they couldn’t hear her conversation.

“Hello, Anna speaking” she said, her voice shaking a little.

“Hi Anna dear, It’s Dr O’connell, is now a good time to talk?”

“Yeah, now’s fine” her heart was beating out of her chest and she barely form a coherent thought

“I’ve just had a look at your blood results and there’s a few abnormalities, I’ll need you to come in as soon as possible for some more tests”

“Right” Anna breathed

“I know that sounds scary love, but it’s not all that bad, I’m going to need to see you again as soon as possible for some more testing and to see if we can get you started on treatment. How does tomorrow at 8:15 sound?”

“Great” Anna said

“Ok love, see you then and bring that nice handsome boy with you to hold your hand”

The heat hit her as soon as she left the building, and she let out an audible huff which made passers by turn their heads and nod at her, acknowledging their own disgust for the hot air. It was a slow walk to the underground but by the time she got there she was already covered in a film of sweat and she couldn’t wait to get to Harry’s. She sat down sat down in the corner of the compartment and pulled her phone out, putting her headphones in and pressing play on her audiobook, hoping that she could focus on something else. With her eyes closed she drifted into a world of her own but it didn’t take long for the headache and stomach pains to set in. She took a sip from her water bottle and drew in a deep breath, her hand clenching her stomach waiting for it to subside a little. When it did, she picked her phone up again and sent Harry a message.

“Can you pick me up from the station, it’s too hot to walk”

“Of course, how far off are you?”

“Two stops”

“I’ll leave now then, see you soon xx”

Anna kept taking in deep breathes as she watched out the window at the black tunnell passing by. She knew she’d be ok once she was out in the open again but right now she wasn’t sure she was going to make it without hurling her guts all through the train compartment. But she did make it and she was the first to get off at her stop. The heat in the underground was almost unbearable though and Anna couldn’t wait to get outside where there was the slightest breeze to cool her a little. True to his word, Harry was waiting outside the tube station in his car and Anna jogged over to it.

“Hi Styles” she huffed, taking her seat leaning over to kiss his cheek

“Bit hot out there?” he laughed

“It’s disgusting, almost puked all over the tube”

His expression fell at the mention of Anna being unwell “You alright now?”

“Yeah” she nodded “I just needed some air”

Harry’s house was cool, he had all the blinds and curtains shut off so that the sun couldn’t get in and his back guest room was set up so that they could spend the entire day in there, escaping the harsh heat. He’d moved the bed out and laid a picnic blanket on the floor with two pillows for them to rest on. His favourite guitar, the one that he used to play “Oh Anna” on tour was sitting in the corner and he had a stack of DVDs sitting on the coffee table, ready for them to watch.

Anna made herself comfortable on the picnic rug and pulled out her laptop. Today was a work day, they’d agreed on that before she came over but the weather made it hard to focus and eventually, Anna gave up on the proposal she was working on and sat and watched as Harry strummed on his guitar. He wasn’t doing anything in particular, just recording a few new riffs that he might be able to use for new songs when he finally gets back into the studio. He had his brown leather notebook laid out and was scrawling lone lyrics down as they came to him but Anna had other ideas for the page and she began doodling all over it, mostly tiny little cartoons of the two of them together and a few other little characters.

“I didn’t know you could draw” Harry said after watching her for a while

[[MORE]]

“I can’t really, I have a doctors appointment tomorrow” Anna said softly when Harry stopped strumming his guitar, “Trying to keep myself distracted”

He put the guitar down and looked at her “Do you want me to come?”

Anna stayed quiet for a moment mulling over her answer “I think so” she finally uttered

“I don’t have to” he said “But I know you’re nervous”

“No, I want you to” she smiled “It’s at 11:30”

“Stay here tonight, I’ll cook us breakfast in the morning” he leant over and kissed her forehead “Everything’s going to be fine An”

“Thanks H” she closed her laptop and laid down on the picnic blanket, staring up at the roof. The air outside had cooled slightly and in the distance dark clouds were rolling in bringing with them the cool change that they so desperately waited for.

Thunder storms had always been Anna’s favourite part of Summer, she loved how the world went dark just beforehand, like the city had suddenly been taken over by dementors, and the rain. She loved watching the rain fall down, and on a day like today, she loved to sit out in it and cool down.

“Let’s go outside” she said after a few minutes of silence after their last conversation.

Harry stood and opened the blinds revealing the dark sky “It’s about to rain love”

“Exactly” she stood and held her hand out, enticing him to grab on. He did, shrugging and grabbing his phone off the floor as Anna dragged him out of the room. She went straight for the back door, but Harry pulled her back towards the stairs.

“No no no” he smiled “if we’re going to be out in the rain, we’re doing it right”

“The rain is that way” Anna giggled pointing at the back door.

“Nope” he kept walking up the stairs “I have a rooftop garden”  

“Of course you do” she rolled her eyes.

They climbed the stairs to the second floor where Harry’s bedroom was and then he dragged her up past his office and the guest bedrooms on the third floor and up to the fourth where Anna had never been before. There wasn’t much to it, a sitting room with a grand piano and some artwork, which Anna guessed was worth more than everything she owned and then some. Thunder roared just as Harry unlocked the door to the rooftop and he flinched a little.

“Not scared of thunder are you Styles?” Anna giggled, walking backwards out into the storm

“No” he huffed, offended that she thought he was scared of anything.

“Whatever” she turned around and took in the view, clouds still rolling in over the city, which was almost entirely visible from there.

“This might just be the best view in London” she said, turning around and looking at it from all angles.

“Yeah” he said, his gaze focused not on the skyline that surrounded them, but on Anna who was completely oblivious to the fact.

A few lone drops started to fall from the sky and Anna stretched her arms out to catch them and then the lone drops turned into a flood of water falling from the sky and she couldn’t stop herself from laughing. Harry was still standing under the eves of the house, watching Anna enjoy the storm, a huge smile stretched across his face.

“Get your butt out here Styles” she said through her giggles, holding her hand out and grabbing onto his. Reluctantly he followed and rain fell down his back, cooling his whole body and turning his white shirt transparent, revealing his chest full of tattoos. With Anna’s hand already in his he pulled her in closer to him, so that they were standing only inches away from each other.

“Let’s sit” Anna whispered, pulling him down to the ground with her. Their bodies were entirely soaked by now, their hair sticking to their faces and dripping down their backs. Lightning flashed across the sky, turning the clouds from black to purple and Anna rested her head on Harry’s shoulders.

“Isn’t this beautiful H?” she whispered, looking up at him.

“You’re beautiful An” he kissed her forehead and used his pointer finger to lift her chin so that she was looking directly at him.

“I love you Anna Louise Elliot”

There they were. Those three words she’d wanted to say for weeks now, finally rolling off his tongue, sending shivers down her spine.

“I love you too Harry Edward Styles” she giggled “always will”

***

“Miss Elliot” Anna’s doctor poked her head around the corner and ushered both her and Harry into the room.

“Just here for a check up today love?” she smiled.

“Not exactly,” Anna blushed “I’ve been having these stomach pains for a while now, they were going away but now it’s constant”

“Ok” Doctor O’connell said, in a soft, sweet tone that only emphasized her Irish accent “Do you remember when it started?”

“Back in June, it started as a migraine”

“And how’s your appetite been?”

“Not great this week, even the thought of food makes me ill”

She nodded, taking some notes on her computer “When was your last period love?”

Anna’s eyes widened “Two months ago”

“Is there a chance you could be pregnant?”

Anna and Harry looked at each other, both of them blushing. Harry’s hand moved onto Anna’s knee, a gesture of comfort.  

“I guess I could be?”  Anna said, embarrassed that she hadn’t thought of that before now.

“When was the last time you had sex?”

“Last Night” they both said quietly but in unison.

“And before that?”

“Friday” Harry said before clearing his throat

“Are you using Condoms?” Dr O’Connell asked, looking at them over her glasses

They both nodded but didn’t say anything, too shocked by the thought of a baby.

“Right well there’s always a chance, so let’s rule that out before we go looking for something else” She turned in her chair and opened the drawer sitting next to her desk, pulling out a specimen jar and slammed it down on the desk next to Anna.

“There’s a bathroom just down the hall, bring this back when you’re finished”

She took the jar and stood from her chair, passed her handbag to Harry without and word and walked out of the room. This couldn’t be real. A baby? How could she be a mother, she could barely look after herself and how could Harry be a dad? He was too busy with work to be able to give the child enough of his time, christ even yesterday when Anna was over he couldn’t leave his guitar alone long enough for them to have a full conversation. Not that she minded, she loved it when he sang. They’d been so careful she wasn’t on the pill, but they always, always used condoms. There was no way there could be a baby in there.

She slid back into Dr O'connell’s office after using the bathroom, with the jar in her hand and placed it back on the desk, red faced with embarrassment.

“Right then” the doctor said warmly as she put on a pair of gloves “Let’s find out if there’s a baby in there.”

Harry held on tightly to Anna knee while they waited for the results to show up on the test stick. Anna’s heart was practically beating out of her chest and Harry couldn’t stop pulling his lip with his free hand. It took three minutes for the results to show, but it felt like three hours and by the time Dr O'connell opened her mouth Anna felt like she was about to throw up.

“It’s negative” she said

They both let out a deep sigh. Thank God. Now wasn’t the time for babies. Harry loosened his grip on Anna’s knee but kept his hand there, because if there was no baby, there was something else.

“Ok, let’s talk more about these stomach pains then because missing two periods isn’t a good sign, what kind of pain is it?” she was speaking with a tone of concern now, instead of excitement.

“Usually, it’s a dull ache all over, but when it gets worse it’s sharp and on my sides”

“Hmmm” she tapped her pen on the desk “could be kidney’s, why don’t you pop up on that bed over there and I’ll examine you”

Anna stood up again and walked over to the examination table. Kidney’s. Couldn’t they go back to the baby idea? That was way less scary. She laid down on the sterilised paper sheets and lifted her shirt just below her bra. Dr O'connell drew the curtains so that Harry couldn’t see and began pressing on Anna’s belly.

“You tell me where it hurts love” she said softly

“Everywhere” she choked until she pressed on her left side, “There” she squeaked “That hurts”

Dr O’Connell took her hands away and helped Anna sit up.

“Ok, next step is to take some bloods and we’ll see what’s going on inside. Are you ok with needles?”

“No” Anna shook her head

“That’s what he’s for” she drew the curtains back and smiled at Harry. “Your presence is required good sir”

Harry giggled “What are boyfriends for”

“Hold her hand and tell her she’s pretty while I get things ready”

There was a reason Anna like Dr O'Connell so much, and it wasn’t necessarily because of her medical expertise, it was more her bedside manner. She always made Anna laugh and that made everything less scary.

“You are very pretty” Harry said “Even if you do look a little pale right now”

Anna smiled sheepishly and grabbed onto Harry’s outstretched hand “I hate needles”

“It’s just a tiny pinch, and you can squeeze my hand as hard as you need to”

The Doctor walked back over to them with a tray of all the things that she needed to take Anna’s blood.

“I’ve gotten good at this over the years love, you won’t even feel it” she said reassuringly, pulling a pair of gloves over her hands and using an alcohol wipe to sterilise the area. Anna held tightly onto to Harry’s hand and squeezed her eyes shut so that she didn’t have to watch what was happening. A tiny sting in her left arm let her know that needle was in and before she knew it Dr O'connell was finished.

“All done dear” she smiled. “Come back and sit down over near the desk and we’ll go over what happens next”

They both followed her back and sat down. Anna didn’t know how she felt at this point, she thought she was nervous, but she didn’t know if that was just the pains coming back again.

“Unfortunately, Anna there’s not much more I can do for you until we get your blood work back, but I want to send you for an ultrasound on your kidneys as well see if we can get a better idea of what’s causing you all this pain.” She turned to her computer and printed out an order for the ultrasound and handed it to Anna. “You make sure you’re drinking plenty of fluids in this weather, you need to stay hydrated” She stood from her chair, which promoted Anna and Harry to do the same

“Thank you for all of your help Dr O’Connell” Anna said

“It’s my pleasure dear, it will take a day or two, but I’ll give you a call with your results, and you make that appointment for that scan as soon as you can” She ushered them out the door

“I will” Anna smiled “Thank you”

***

“Those one’s” Harry said pointing to the red pair of sunglasses that sat on Anna’s dressing table

“Really?” Anna questioned “You think she’ll like them?

“She’ll like you so it doesn’t matter”  he checked his phone to see that it was already twenty past eleven “she won’t if we’re late though, we better get going”

“Fine” Anna huffed pushing the sunglasses onto her face

“You look stunning as always, plus she’s my sister so she doesn’t care what you look like”

Anna was finally getting to meet Gemma, and to say that she was nervous was an understatement. She knew how much his family meant to Harry and she also knew much he cared what they thought.

“Have you got your phone love?” He asked before closing the door to her flat

“When do I not have my phone?” she giggled

“Just checking, Dr O'connell might ring back, that’s all”

That was the last thing she needed to be reminded of right now, but it had been a few days since her appointment and the blood results would be back any time now.

They weren’t doing anything overly exciting with Gemma, just a pub lunch, Charli had even agreed to join them and take the pressure off a little. It didn’t help that Anna wasn’t feeling well anyway, but when they walked in and saw that Gemma was already sitting at the bar, Anna’s stomach dropped.

“It’s a little early for wine isn’t Gems?” Harry said, startling her.

“I thought it was getting close to five, you’re so late” she said sarcastically although Anna was pretty sure she wasn’t joking

“Sorry” Harry sighed “My fault, couldn’t find my car keys”

She shrugged and Anna let go of the breath that she’d taken when Gemma mentioned being late, grateful that Harry had taken the blame.

“I haven’t seen you in months, where’s my hug?” she said.

Harry obliged and wrapped his arms around her. It warmed Anna’s heart how close they were, even after spending months apart they could go back to being the best of friends, which said something about them both as people.

As they pulled away from the hug, Gemma turned straight to Anna and held out her hand.

“I’m Gemma, it’s nice to finally meet you, this dickhead hasn’t shut up about you since he met you”

“Likewise” Anna smiled “I’m Anna by the way”

“I know hun” Gemma nodded. “Alright, let’s find somewhere to sit, shall we?”

“Let’s go outside, it’s too nice out to be inside” Anna added, needing the fresh air to calm her nerves.

“Good idea” Harry nodded and grabbed onto her hand.

Once they found a seat and ordered their meals, Anna began to ease into the conversation and by the time Charli arrived, Anna couldn’t remember why she was so nervous about this, Gemma was just as lovely as Harry. She wasn’t over protective of him, she didn’t question why Anna was with him and maybe that was because she could see that he was totally in love with her and that’s all that matters.

“Hiya” Charli said as she made her way over to their table “I’m so so sorry I’m late, got stuck in a meeting”

“Happens to the best of us” Harry said, smiling at her

“I ordered you some vegetarian lasagna” Anna said, moving closer to Harry so that Charli could sit down next to her

“I’m Charli,” she said to Gemma “Anna’s manger slash best friend”

“I’m Gemma” she said in response “Harry’s sister slash life coach”

“That’s a bold statement” Harry chimed in “Don’t let jeffy hear you say that”

“Aww, I miss Jeffy” Gemma sighed “How is he?”

Conversion continued to flow easily as Harry and Anna recapped the tour, and Gemma and Charli filled them both in on what they’d missed in London while they’d been gone. There were times when they would break into two separate conversations but it always came back to the four of them and Harry always kept his hand on Anna’s knee.

Their food arrived and everyone started eating but the smell of it made Anna feel ill and she was only a few bites in before she had to stop. Harry knew not to say anything in front of Gemma, but he gave her a worried look that she just shrugged off, not being able to do anything about it right now.

“That looks good, An” Harry said, a mouth still half full of his own lunch “Can I steal some?”

She could see what he was doing and she played along “Don’t you ever eat your own food?” she said sarcastically to make the whole thing look more real.

“Yours looks better” he shrugged reaching over and taking some chips from her plate

“He’s always been like this” Gemma added, “won’t settle until he’s tried everyone’s food”

“Don’t want any of yours” he said, using his fork to take a mouthful of pasta from Anna’s plate. He continued to subtly take her food, until her plate was almost empty and her phone started to ring. His grip tightened on her knee when he saw that the number on her screen was Dr O'Connell’s. She looked at him nervously before she picked it up and stood from her seat at the table, walking away so that they couldn’t hear her conversation.

“Hello, Anna speaking” she said, her voice shaking a little.

“Hi Anna dear, It’s Dr O’connell, is now a good time to talk?”

“Yeah, now’s fine” her heart was beating out of her chest and she barely form a coherent thought

“I’ve just had a look at your blood results and there’s a few abnormalities, I’ll need you to come in as soon as possible for some more tests”

“Right” Anna breathed

“I know that sounds scary love, but it’s not all that bad, I’m going to need to see you again as soon as possible for some more testing and to see if we can get you started on treatment. How does tomorrow at 8:15 sound?”

“Great” Anna said

“Ok love, see you then and bring that nice handsome boy with you to hold your hand”

She laid down on the sterilised paper sheets and lifted her shirt just below her bra. Dr O'connell drew the curtains so that Harry couldn’t see and began pressing on Anna’s belly.

“You tell me where it hurts love” she said softly

“Everywhere” she choked until she pressed on her left side, “There” she squeaked “That hurts”

Dr O’Connell took her hands away and helped Anna sit up.

“Ok, next step is to take some bloods and we’ll see what’s going on inside. Are you ok with needles?”

“No” Anna shook her head

“That’s what he’s for” she drew the curtains back and smiled at Harry. “Your presence is required good sir”

Harry giggled “What are boyfriends for”

“Hold her hand and tell her she’s pretty while I get things ready”

There was a reason Anna like Dr O'Connell so much, and it wasn’t necessarily because of her medical expertise, it was more her bedside manner. She always made Anna laugh and that made everything less scary.

“You are very pretty” Harry said “Even if you do look a little pale right now”

Anna smiled sheepishly and grabbed onto Harry’s outstretched hand “I hate needles”

“It’s just a tiny pinch, and you can squeeze my hand as hard as you need to”

The Doctor walked back over to them with a tray of all the things that she needed to take Anna’s blood.

“I’ve gotten good at this over the years love, you won’t even feel it” she said reassuringly, pulling a pair of gloves over her hands and using an alcohol wipe to sterilise the area. Anna held tightly onto to Harry’s hand and squeezed her eyes shut so that she didn’t have to watch what was happening. A tiny sting in her left arm let her know that needle was in and before she knew it Dr O'connell was finished.

“All done dear” she smiled. “Come back and sit down over near the desk and we’ll go over what happens next”

They both followed her back and sat down. Anna didn’t know how she felt at this point, she thought she was nervous, but she didn’t know if that was just the pains coming back again.

“Unfortunately, Anna there’s not much more I can do for you until we get your blood work back, but I want to send you for an ultrasound on your kidneys as well see if we can get a better idea of what’s causing you all this pain.” She turned to her computer and printed out an order for the ultrasound and handed it to Anna. “You make sure you’re drinking plenty of fluids in this weather, you need to stay hydrated” She stood from her chair, which promoted Anna and Harry to do the same

“Thank you for all of your help Dr O’Connell” Anna said

“It’s my pleasure dear, it will take a day or two, but I’ll give you a call with your results, and you make that appointment for that scan as soon as you can” She ushered them out the door

“I will” Anna smiled “Thank you”

***

“Those one’s” Harry said pointing to the red pair of sunglasses that sat on Anna’s dressing table

“Really?” Anna questioned “You think she’ll like them?

“She’ll like you so it doesn’t matter”  he checked his phone to see that it was already twenty past eleven “she won’t if we’re late though, we better get going”

“Fine” Anna huffed pushing the sunglasses onto her face

“You look stunning as always, plus she’s my sister so she doesn’t care what you look like”

Anna was finally getting to meet Gemma, and to say that she was nervous was an understatement. She knew how much his family meant to Harry and she also knew much he cared what they thought.

“Have you got your phone love?” He asked before closing the door to her flat

“When do I not have my phone?” she giggled

“Just checking, Dr O'connell might ring back, that’s all”

That was the last thing she needed to be reminded of right now, but it had been a few days since her appointment and the blood results would be back any time now.

They weren’t doing anything overly exciting with Gemma, just a pub lunch, Charli had even agreed to join them and take the pressure off a little. It didn’t help that Anna wasn’t feeling well anyway, but when they walked in and saw that Gemma was already sitting at the bar, Anna’s stomach dropped.

“It’s a little early for wine isn’t Gems?” Harry said, startling her.

“I thought it was getting close to five, you’re so late” she said sarcastically although Anna was pretty sure she wasn’t joking

“Sorry” Harry sighed “My fault, couldn’t find my car keys”

She shrugged and Anna let go of the breath that she’d taken when Gemma mentioned being late, grateful that Harry had taken the blame.

“I haven’t seen you in months, where’s my hug?” she said.

Harry obliged and wrapped his arms around her. It warmed Anna’s heart how close they were, even after spending months apart they could go back to being the best of friends, which said something about them both as people.

As they pulled away from the hug, Gemma turned straight to Anna and held out her hand.

“I’m Gemma, it’s nice to finally meet you, this dickhead hasn’t shut up about you since he met you”

“Likewise” Anna smiled “I’m Anna by the way”

“I know hun” Gemma nodded. “Alright, let’s find somewhere to sit, shall we?”

“Let’s go outside, it’s too nice out to be inside” Anna added, needing the fresh air to calm her nerves.

“Good idea” Harry nodded and grabbed onto her hand.

Once they found a seat and ordered their meals, Anna began to ease into the conversation and by the time Charli arrived, Anna couldn’t remember why she was so nervous about this, Gemma was just as lovely as Harry. She wasn’t over protective of him, she didn’t question why Anna was with him and maybe that was because she could see that he was totally in love with her and that’s all that matters.

“Hiya” Charli said as she made her way over to their table “I’m so so sorry I’m late, got stuck in a meeting”

“Happens to the best of us” Harry said, smiling at her

“I ordered you some vegetarian lasagna” Anna said, moving closer to Harry so that Charli could sit down next to her

“I’m Charli,” she said to Gemma “Anna’s manger slash best friend”

“I’m Gemma” she said in response “Harry’s sister slash life coach”

“That’s a bold statement” Harry chimed in “Don’t let jeffy hear you say that”

“Aww, I miss Jeffy” Gemma sighed “How is he?”

There were times when they would break into two separate conversations but it always came back to the four of them and Harry always kept his hand on Anna’s knee.

Their food arrived and everyone started eating but the smell of it made Anna feel ill and she was only a few bites in before she had to stop. Harry knew not to say anything in front of Gemma, but he gave her a worried look that she just shrugged off, not being able to do anything about it right now.

“That looks good, An” Harry said, a mouth still half full of his own lunch “Can I steal some?”

She could see what he was doing and she played along “Don’t you ever eat your own food?” she said sarcastically to make the whole thing look more real.

“Yours looks better” he shrugged reaching over and taking some chips from her plate

“He’s always been like this” Gemma added, “won’t settle until he’s tried everyone’s food”

“Don’t want any of yours” he said, using his fork to take a mouthful of pasta from Anna’s plate. He continued to subtly take her food, until her plate was almost empty and her phone started to ring. His grip tightened on her knee when he saw that the number on her screen was Dr O'Connell’s. She looked at him nervously before she picked it up and stood from her seat at the table, walking away so that they couldn’t hear her conversation.

“Hello, Anna speaking” she said, her voice shaking a little.

“Hi Anna dear, It’s Dr O’connell, is now a good time to talk?”

“Yeah, now’s fine” her heart was beating out of her chest and she barely form a coherent thought

“I’ve just had a look at your blood results and there’s a few abnormalities, I’ll need you to come in as soon as possible for some more tests”

“Right” Anna breathed

“I know that sounds scary love, but it’s not all that bad, I’m going to need to see you again as soon as possible for some more testing and to see if we can get you started on treatment. How does tomorrow at 8:15 sound?”

“Great” Anna said

“Ok love, see you then and bring that nice handsome boy with you to hold your hand”

This is a really important chapter, and I’m not going to lie, I got a little emotional while I was writing it, so I’m going to apologise now. Let me know how you’re feeling about it all. 

Again, a massive shout out to @lovesmelikebrandnewstarlight for helping me with this chapter and all the others, this story really wouldn’t have happened without her. 

                                                         ***

Anna was sick of the heat. London had suffered through weeks of abnormally hot weather and now she was counting down the days until Autumn began. Her flat was on the 5th floor of her building and she just couldn’t cool it down no matter how hard she tried, and Harry’s house wasn’t much better, but there were at least a few rooms that didn’t get direct sunlight that they could hide away in. The only problem was, Harry lived on the other side of London and that meant that a long stuffy tube ride to get there and she knew that would probably give her another headache, but if she wanted to be cool, she didn’t really have another choice. So she gathered her things together and made sure she got her cold bottle of water out of the fridge and locked the door behind her.

The heat hit her as soon as she left the building, and she let out an audible huff which made passers by turn their heads and nod at her, acknowledging their own disgust for the hot air. It was a slow walk to the underground but by the time she got there she was already covered in a film of sweat and she couldn’t wait to get to Harry’s. She sat down sat down in the corner of the compartment and pulled her phone out, putting her headphones in and pressing play on her audiobook, hoping that she could focus on something else. With her eyes closed she drifted into a world of her own but it didn’t take long for the headache and stomach pains to set in. She took a sip from her water bottle and drew in a deep breath, her hand clenching her stomach waiting for it to subside a little. When it did, she picked her phone up again and sent Harry a message.

“Can you pick me up from the station, it’s too hot to walk”

“Of course, how far off are you?”

“Two stops”

“I’ll leave now then, see you soon xx”

Anna kept taking in deep breathes as she watched out the window at the black tunnell passing by. She knew she’d be ok once she was out in the open again but right now she wasn’t sure she was going to make it without hurling her guts all through the train compartment. But she did make it and she was the first to get off at her stop. The heat in the underground was almost unbearable though and Anna couldn’t wait to get outside where there was the slightest breeze to cool her a little. True to his word, Harry was waiting outside the tube station in his car and Anna jogged over to it.

“Hi Styles” she huffed, taking her seat leaning over to kiss his cheek

“Bit hot out there?” he laughed

“It’s disgusting, almost puked all over the tube”

His expression fell at the mention of Anna being unwell “You alright now?”

“Yeah” she nodded “I just needed some air”

Harry’s house was cool, he had all the blinds and curtains shut off so that the sun couldn’t get in and his back guest room was set up so that they could spend the entire day in there, escaping the harsh heat. He’d moved the bed out and laid a picnic blanket on the floor with two pillows for them to rest on. His favourite guitar, the one that he used to play “Oh Anna” on tour was sitting in the corner and he had a stack of DVDs sitting on the coffee table, ready for them to watch.

Anna made herself comfortable on the picnic rug and pulled out her laptop. Today was a work day, they’d agreed on that before she came over but the weather made it hard to focus and eventually, Anna gave up on the proposal she was working on and sat and watched as Harry strummed on his guitar. He wasn’t doing anything in particular, just recording a few new riffs that he might be able to use for new songs when he finally gets back into the studio. He had his brown leather notebook laid out and was scrawling lone lyrics down as they came to him but Anna had other ideas for the page and she began doodling all over it, mostly tiny little cartoons of the two of them together and a few other little characters.

“I didn’t know you could draw” Harry said after watching her for a while

“I can’t really, I have a doctors appointment tomorrow” Anna said softly when Harry stopped strumming his guitar, “Trying to keep myself distracted”

He put the guitar down and looked at her “Do you want me to come?”

Anna stayed quiet for a moment mulling over her answer “I think so” she finally uttered

“I don’t have to” he said “But I know you’re nervous”

“No, I want you to” she smiled “It’s at 11:30”

“Stay here tonight, I’ll cook us breakfast in the morning” he leant over and kissed her forehead “Everything’s going to be fine An”

“Thanks H” she closed her laptop and laid down on the picnic blanket, staring up at the roof. The air outside had cooled slightly and in the distance dark clouds were rolling in bringing with them the cool change that they so desperately waited for.

Thunder storms had always been Anna’s favourite part of Summer, she loved how the world went dark just beforehand, like the city had suddenly been taken over by dementors, and the rain. She loved watching the rain fall down, and on a day like today, she loved to sit out in it and cool down.

“Let’s go outside” she said after a few minutes of silence after their last conversation.

Harry stood and opened the blinds revealing the dark sky “It’s about to rain love”

“Exactly” she stood and held her hand out, enticing him to grab on. He did, shrugging and grabbing his phone off the floor as Anna dragged him out of the room. She went straight for the back door, but Harry pulled her back towards the stairs.

“No no no” he smiled “if we’re going to be out in the rain, we’re doing it right”

“The rain is that way” Anna giggled pointing at the back door.

“Nope” he kept walking up the stairs “I have a rooftop garden”  

“Of course you do” she rolled her eyes.

They climbed the stairs to the second floor where Harry’s bedroom was and then he dragged her up past his office and the guest bedrooms on the third floor and up to the fourth where Anna had never been before. There wasn’t much to it, a sitting room with a grand piano and some artwork, which Anna guessed was worth more than everything she owned and then some. Thunder roared just as Harry unlocked the door to the rooftop and he flinched a little.

“Not scared of thunder are you Styles?” Anna giggled, walking backwards out into the storm

“No” he huffed, offended that she thought he was scared of anything.

“Whatever” she turned around and took in the view, clouds still rolling in over the city, which was almost entirely visible from there.

“This might just be the best view in London” she said, turning around and looking at it from all angles.

“Yeah” he said, his gaze focused not on the skyline that surrounded them, but on Anna who was completely oblivious to the fact.

A few lone drops started to fall from the sky and Anna stretched her arms out to catch them and then the lone drops turned into a flood of water falling from the sky and she couldn’t stop herself from laughing. Harry was still standing under the eves of the house, watching Anna enjoy the storm, a huge smile stretched across his face.

“Get your butt out here Styles” she said through her giggles, holding her hand out and grabbing onto his. Reluctantly he followed and rain fell down his back, cooling his whole body and turning his white shirt transparent, revealing his chest full of tattoos. With Anna’s hand already in his he pulled her in closer to him, so that they were standing only inches away from each other.

“Let’s sit” Anna whispered, pulling him down to the ground with her. Their bodies were entirely soaked by now, their hair sticking to their faces and dripping down their backs. Lightning flashed across the sky, turning the clouds from black to purple and Anna rested her head on Harry’s shoulders.

“Isn’t this beautiful H?” she whispered, looking up at him.

“You’re beautiful An” he kissed her forehead and used his pointer finger to lift her chin so that she was looking directly at him.

“I love you Anna Louise Elliot”

There they were. Those three words she’d wanted to say for weeks now, finally rolling off his tongue, sending shivers down her spine.

“I love you too Harry Edward Styles” she giggled “always will”

“Miss Elliot” Anna’s doctor poked her head around the corner and ushered both her and Harry into the room.

“Just here for a check up today love?” she smiled.

“Not exactly,” Anna blushed “I’ve been having these stomach pains for a while now, they were going away but now it’s constant”

“Ok” Doctor O’connell said, in a soft, sweet tone that only emphasized her Irish accent “Do you remember when it started?”

“Back in June, it started as a migraine”

“And how’s your appetite been?”

“Not great this week, even the thought of food makes me ill”

She nodded, taking some notes on her computer “When was your last period love?”

Anna’s eyes widened “Two months ago”

“Is there a chance you could be pregnant?”

Anna and Harry looked at each other, both of them blushing. Harry’s hand moved onto Anna’s knee, a gesture of comfort.  

“I guess I could be?”  Anna said, embarrassed that she hadn’t thought of that before now.

“When was the last time you had sex?”

“Last Night” they both said quietly but in unison.

“And before that?”

“Friday” Harry said before clearing his throat

They both nodded but didn’t say anything, too shocked by the thought of a baby.

She took the jar and stood from her chair, passed her handbag to Harry without and word and walked out of the room. This couldn’t be real. A baby? How could she be a mother, she could barely look after herself and how could Harry be a dad? He was too busy with work to be able to give the child enough of his time, christ even yesterday when Anna was over he couldn’t leave his guitar alone long enough for them to have a full conversation. Not that she minded, she loved it when he sang. They’d been so careful she wasn’t on the pill, but they always, always used condoms. There was no way there could be a baby in there.

She slid back into Dr O'connell’s office after using the bathroom, with the jar in her hand and placed it back on the desk, red faced with embarrassment.

“Right then” the doctor said warmly as she put on a pair of gloves “Let’s find out if there’s a baby in there.”

Harry held on tightly to Anna knee while they waited for the results to show up on the test stick. Anna’s heart was practically beating out of her chest and Harry couldn’t stop pulling his lip with his free hand. It took three minutes for the results to show, but it felt like three hours and by the time Dr O'connell opened her mouth Anna felt like she was about to throw up.

“It’s negative” she said

They both let out a deep sigh. Thank God. Now wasn’t the time for babies. Harry loosened his grip on Anna’s knee but kept his hand there, because if there was no baby, there was something else.

“Ok, let’s talk more about these stomach pains then because missing two periods isn’t a good sign, what kind of pain is it?” she was speaking with a tone of concern now, instead of excitement.

“Usually, it’s a dull ache all over, but when it gets worse it’s sharp and on my sides”

“Hmmm” she tapped her pen on the desk “could be kidney’s, why don’t you pop up on that bed over there and I’ll examine you”

Anna stood up again and walked over to the examination table. Kidney’s. Couldn’t they go back to the baby idea? That was way less scary. She laid down on the sterilised paper sheets and lifted her shirt just below her bra. Dr O'connell drew the curtains so that Harry couldn’t see and began pressing on Anna’s belly.

Dr O’Connell took her hands away and helped Anna sit up.

“No” Anna shook her head

“That’s what he’s for” she drew the curtains back and smiled at Harry. “Your presence is required good sir”

Harry giggled “What are boyfriends for”

“Hold her hand and tell her she’s pretty while I get things ready”

There was a reason Anna like Dr O'Connell so much, and it wasn’t necessarily because of her medical expertise, it was more her bedside manner. She always made Anna laugh and that made everything less scary.

“You are very pretty” Harry said “Even if you do look a little pale right now”

Anna smiled sheepishly and grabbed onto Harry’s outstretched hand “I hate needles”

“It’s just a tiny pinch, and you can squeeze my hand as hard as you need to”

The Doctor walked back over to them with a tray of all the things that she needed to take Anna’s blood.

“I’ve gotten good at this over the years love, you won’t even feel it” she said reassuringly, pulling a pair of gloves over her hands and using an alcohol wipe to sterilise the area. Anna held tightly onto to Harry’s hand and squeezed her eyes shut so that she didn’t have to watch what was happening. A tiny sting in her left arm let her know that needle was in and before she knew it Dr O'connell was finished.

“All done dear” she smiled. “Come back and sit down over near the desk and we’ll go over what happens next”

They both followed her back and sat down. Anna didn’t know how she felt at this point, she thought she was nervous, but she didn’t know if that was just the pains coming back again.

“Unfortunately, Anna there’s not much more I can do for you until we get your blood work back, but I want to send you for an ultrasound on your kidneys as well see if we can get a better idea of what’s causing you all this pain.” She turned to her computer and printed out an order for the ultrasound and handed it to Anna. “You make sure you’re drinking plenty of fluids in this weather, you need to stay hydrated” She stood from her chair, which promoted Anna and Harry to do the same

“I will” Anna smiled “Thank you”

“I’ll leave now then, see you soon xx”

Anna kept taking in deep breathes as she watched out the window at the black tunnell passing by. She knew she’d be ok once she was out in the open again but right now she wasn’t sure she was going to make it without hurling her guts all through the train compartment. But she did make it and she was the first to get off at her stop. The heat in the underground was almost unbearable though and Anna couldn’t wait to get outside where there was the slightest breeze to cool her a little. True to his word, Harry was waiting outside the tube station in his car and Anna jogged over to it.

“Hi Styles” she huffed, taking her seat leaning over to kiss his cheek

“Bit hot out there?” he laughed

“It’s disgusting, almost puked all over the tube”

His expression fell at the mention of Anna being unwell “You alright now?”

“Yeah” she nodded “I just needed some air”

Harry’s house was cool, he had all the blinds and curtains shut off so that the sun couldn’t get in and his back guest room was set up so that they could spend the entire day in there, escaping the harsh heat. He’d moved the bed out and laid a picnic blanket on the floor with two pillows for them to rest on. His favourite guitar, the one that he used to play “Oh Anna” on tour was sitting in the corner and he had a stack of DVDs sitting on the coffee table, ready for them to watch.

Anna made herself comfortable on the picnic rug and pulled out her laptop. Today was a work day, they’d agreed on that before she came over but the weather made it hard to focus and eventually, Anna gave up on the proposal she was working on and sat and watched as Harry strummed on his guitar. He wasn’t doing anything in particular, just recording a few new riffs that he might be able to use for new songs when he finally gets back into the studio. He had his brown leather notebook laid out and was scrawling lone lyrics down as they came to him but Anna had other ideas for the page and she began doodling all over it, mostly tiny little cartoons of the two of them together and a few other little characters.

“I didn’t know you could draw” Harry said after watching her for a while

title: BRUISES part 2
body:
ABOUT THE STORY

Part 2

HARRY

I glance at her as i unlock the door of my room. Her lips curl more when our eyes meet and surprisingly, mine too.

“Sorry for the mess.” I apologize, pushing on the door and walking in. “I didn’t expect to have anyone over.”

She chuckles and her eyes travel around my room as i close the door behind her. I look at her for a few seconds and finally drop my bag in the corner of the room. I make sure my wallet and my phone are in my pockets and look up at her when she turns back to me.

“You should see my room.” she lets out, her eyes meeting mine. “I’m a messy person, you’re just an amateur.”

It makes me laugh as i search on my bed to find a sweater. I finally grab a grey one and smile, walking back up to her. She still looks at my stuff and i find that endearing somehow.

“You live here alone?”

“Yea.” I nod quickly and just shrug. “I wanted some privacy this year, so i asked to have my own room.”

Her nose moves up in a grimace and it makes me smile more. I remember she used to do that too when we were young but somehow, now that she’s older, it was even more adorable.

“You’re lucky, I have a roommate and she’s a real pain in the ass.”

We both laugh a bit and i shrug again as i walk back to the door.

“If you need an escape, you can always crash here.” I propose, opening the door before following her outside. “You’re always welcome, don’t even hesitate.”

When I turn around, I don’t expect her to be so close and out eyes meet. She doesn’t back away and I smile fondly, staring at her. My gaze drops to her mouth when she licks her lips and she chuckles again.

“Thanks, I may actually take you up on that offer.”

It was not something I noticed when we were kids, but now that she was so close to me, I realized how pretty she was. I remain breathless for a few seconds before to let the air out of my lungs with a short laugh.

“Yea, that’s what friends are for, right?” I add awkwardly as she takes a step further. “And you’re probably my oldest friend, so.”

“You never know,” she starts, glancing at me with a smirk gracing her lips as we walk back to the car. “Maybe we could be best friends again.”

I send her an amused grin and shake my head slightly. This is exactly how I actually remember her and I quite like it.

“You never know.” I simply repeat, winking at her and making her laugh.

OLIVIA

His room was not even messy. Some pieces of clothing here and there and a few books he probably left open after studying was not what i considered ‘a mess’. It’s nothing compared to the mess of my room. I try to look everywhere in his room, perhaps to get to know him better. I know about the kid he was, but the man he became is still a mystery.

When we finally get to the restaurant, the waitress brings us to a table in the back and i sit in front of him, a bit speechless. I don’t even know where to start. We both grab a menu, probably both a bit shy and i finally put it down and tilt my head.

“I don’t want things to be awkward between us, Harry.”

His head moves up and when he dives his gaze in mine, it makes me smile.

“It’s not, Liv.” he assures me, putting his menu away. “I’m actually happy we ran into each other.”

I make my choice and breathe in, giving him my full attention. We hadn’t seen each other in years. After he moved away, we didn’t really keep in touch, we were a bit too young to know how and we just sort of lost each other.

“Me too.” he says, leaning against the bench. “So what’s new? Boyfriend? Girlfriend, perhaps?”

“A few of both!” I let out with a laugh, letting my fingers play with one of my rings. “Nothing serious in a while. What about you? If my memory serves me well, you were a bit of a flirt back then.”

He doesn’t even look offended and just shrugs. What I really remember is everyone being in love with him. He just had this way to drag people to him without even trying. He was good at making anyone feel important, like no one else mattered.

“I’ve dated some girls, not too many steady relationships. The last one didn’t en very well, so i’m in no hurry to get back into anything serious.”

His words make me frown and my lips part to ask him a question but he cuts me off before I could even say a word.

“Anyway right now, i’m trying to focus on school, so i’m very much single.”

The left corner of my lips moved up slightly. Why did that make me feel better suddenly?

“Good, that means more time for your friends!” I joke, making him chuckle.

He nods and i lick my lips, noticing that his bright green eyes seem to sparkle. I like it. I want to ask him about his last relationship but I decide not to. We barely just started talking again and we were clearly not close enough to get into deep conversations. Not yet, at least.

“So tell me more about you, I want to know everything.”

“I’ve dated some girls, not too many steady relationships. The last one didn’t en very well, so i’m in no hurry to get back into anything serious.”

His words make me frown and my lips part to ask him a question but he cuts me off before I could even say a word.

“Anyway right now, i’m trying to focus on school, so i’m very much single.”

The left corner of my lips moved up slightly. Why did that make me feel better suddenly?

“Good, that means more time for your friends!” I joke, making him chuckle.

He nods and i lick my lips, noticing that his bright green eyes seem to sparkle. I like it. I want to ask him about his last relationship but I decide not to. We barely just started talking again and we were clearly not close enough to get into deep conversations. Not yet, at least.

“So tell me more about you, I want to know everything.”
trail.content:
ABOUT THE STORY

Part 2

HARRY

I glance at her as i unlock the door of my room. Her lips curl more when our eyes meet and surprisingly, mine too.

“Sorry for the mess.” I apologize, pushing on the door and walking in. “I didn’t expect to have anyone over.”

She chuckles and her eyes travel around my room as i close the door behind her. I look at her for a few seconds and finally drop my bag in the corner of the room. I make sure my wallet and my phone are in my pockets and look up at her when she turns back to me.

“You should see my room.” she lets out, her eyes meeting mine. “I’m a messy person, you’re just an amateur.”

It makes me laugh as i search on my bed to find a sweater. I finally grab a grey one and smile, walking back up to her. She still looks at my stuff and i find that endearing somehow.

“You live here alone?”

“Yea.” I nod quickly and just shrug. “I wanted some privacy this year, so i asked to have my own room.”

Her nose moves up in a grimace and it makes me smile more. I remember she used to do that too when we were young but somehow, now that she’s older, it was even more adorable.

“You’re lucky, I have a roommate and she’s a real pain in the ass.”

We both laugh a bit and i shrug again as i walk back to the door.

“If you need an escape, you can always crash here.” I propose, opening the door before following her outside. “You’re always welcome, don’t even hesitate.”

When I turn around, I don’t expect her to be so close and out eyes meet. She doesn’t back away and I smile fondly, staring at her. My gaze drops to her mouth when she licks her lips and she chuckles again.

“Thanks, I may actually take you up on that offer.”

It was not something I noticed when we were kids, but now that she was so close to me, I realized how pretty she was. I remain breathless for a few seconds before to let the air out of my lungs with a short laugh.

“Yea, that’s what friends are for, right?” I add awkwardly as she takes a step further. “And you’re probably my oldest friend, so.”

“You never know,” she starts, glancing at me with a smirk gracing her lips as we walk back to the car. “Maybe we could be best friends again.”

I send her an amused grin and shake my head slightly. This is exactly how I actually remember her and I quite like it.

“You never know.” I simply repeat, winking at her and making her laugh.

OLIVIA

His room was not even messy. Some pieces of clothing here and there and a few books he probably left open after studying was not what i considered ‘a mess’. It’s nothing compared to the mess of my room. I try to look everywhere in his room, perhaps to get to know him better. I know about the kid he was, but the man he became is still a mystery.

When we finally get to the restaurant, the waitress brings us to a table in the back and i sit in front of him, a bit speechless. I don’t even know where to start. We both grab a menu, probably both a bit shy and i finally put it down and tilt my head.

“I don’t want things to be awkward between us, Harry.”

His head moves up and when he dives his gaze in mine, it makes me smile.

“It’s not, Liv.” he assures me, putting his menu away. “I’m actually happy we ran into each other.”

I make my choice and breathe in, giving him my full attention. We hadn’t seen each other in years. After he moved away, we didn’t really keep in touch, we were a bit too young to know how and we just sort of lost each other.

“Me too.” he says, leaning against the bench. “So what’s new? Boyfriend? Girlfriend, perhaps?”

“A few of both!” I let out with a laugh, letting my fingers play with one of my rings. “Nothing serious in a while. What about you? If my memory serves me well, you were a bit of a flirt back then.”

He doesn’t even look offended and just shrugs. What I really remember is everyone being in love with him. He just had this way to drag people to him without even trying. He was good at making anyone feel important, like no one else mattered.

“I’ve dated some girls, not too many steady relationships. The last one didn’t en very well, so i’m in no hurry to get back into anything serious.”

His words make me frown and my lips part to ask him a question but he cuts me off before I could even say a word.

“Anyway right now, i’m trying to focus on school, so i’m very much single.”

The left corner of my lips moved up slightly. Why did that make me feel better suddenly?

“Good, that means more time for your friends!” I joke, making him chuckle.

He nods and i lick my lips, noticing that his bright green eyes seem to sparkle. I like it. I want to ask him about his last relationship but I decide not to. We barely just started talking again and we were clearly not close enough to get into deep conversations. Not yet, at least.

“So tell me more about you, I want to know everything.”
